lom:description.lom:string:
Strange Matter is an extensive, interactive resource about the wonders of materials. It includes a teacher curriculum/activity guide for integrating materials science into their 5th-8th grade science curriculums, including hands on activities that are based on the National Science Education Standards. Additionally, there is a section of a site that guides families on experiments they can do at home. The site includes the categories of ZOOM (examining structure), TRANSFORM (materials processing) , CRUSH (mechanical properties of materials) and IMPROVE (design for performance).
Strange Matter was developed and is managed by the Materials Research Society with additional support from the National Science Foundation and the Ontario Science Center.

lom:keyword.lom:string: strange matter, materials science demonstrations, materials properties, materials processing, materials structure, materials performance
